value.title: Power BI One Slicer to filter other slicers based on Items that has value only without BI Direction
value.excerpt: In a star schema design, how you can filter one dimension by another dimension. How you can find all the products that this customer purchased or all customers who have purchased this product using two separate slicers. To learn more about star schema: https://radacad.com/power-bi-basics-of-modeling-star-schema-and-how-to-build-it

value.title: Power BI Subscription   Get Report Updates In Email
value.excerpt: Have you ever wondered is it possible to have updates of the Power BI report to be emailed to you (or some other colleagues) on a daily basis? Power BI, fortunately, has this feature, it is called Subscription. Subscriptions are helpful ways to send an up-to-date version of the report and dashboard to

value.title: Power BI Visualization Tip   Hide or Lock the Filter for Users
value.excerpt: I have previously explained that we have three scopes of filtering in the Power BI visualization. The filter created in the filter pane can be often changed or viewed by the user. However, there is a simple way to hide or lock it from the user. In this article and video, I explain how that works. Read

value.title: Removing the Total Value for a Column in the Table Visual of Power BI Using ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: Table visual is one of the most commonly used visuals. In Power BI, you can turn off the total row (when it won’t make sense to have the total) entirely. However, you cannot turn off the total for some columns and keep it working for the others. Using a DAX function, you can, however, do this easily.

value.title: Sentiment Colors for Gauge Visual in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gauge Visual is a great visual for KPIs, however, the Gauge visual in Power BI doesn’t have the sentiment colors as an option. Sentiment colors make a gauge much more understandable, you can easily find out is the value high, low, or in the mid-range. Fortunately, there is conditional formatting that

value.title: Share Different Visual Pages with Different Security Groups in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have written a dozen of blogs and a book about Power BI row-level security and the security on the dataset. value.title: Showing an alternate text when no data available in a Power BI chart visuals
value.excerpt: If you have a visual in the Power BI, that based on some selections of a slicer it might return nothing, depends on the visual, you might get a blank visual or some other types of improper view. In this video, I share a simple trick that you can use to have an alternate message in those scenarios. Read

value.title: Split Column by Delimiter in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: If you have a delimiter character (or part of the text) that is repeated multiple times, and you want to extract all the text parts based on that, there is a simple way for it. In this article, I'll explain how to extract multiple parts of a text value based on a delimiter in Power BI using Power Query.
